intro: Tectaridium macleanii, commonly known as the Maclean's tectaridium, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in areas with high altitude and cool temperatures. Its flowers are usually small and pale, often appearing in clusters, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Tectaridium macleanii is considered a species of conservation concern.
